flags.title: Unpublished
flags.text: This project guide will not appear in search results but can still be viewed by anyone!

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I have a range of new LED lighting kits and parts available. I have designed street lights / down lights / pool lights / commercial lighting kits as well.

Keep a lookout as I will be bringing out more LED lighting kits from my design range. Now you can build up your own LED lights, and if you what to learn about LEDs then my new LED kits should do the job! They are ideal for schools and clubs or someone who just wants to change to LED lighting in their home or business.

Whatever the case may be I am available any time to help out, so if you need a kit or LED parts then let me know by email (eyecatchu@yahoo.com.au) or by Mob: 0408458645.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I have a range of new LED lighting kits and parts available. I have designed street lights / down lights / pool lights / commercial lighting kits as well.

Keep a lookout as I will be bringing out more LED lighting kits from my design range. Now you can build up your own LED lights, and if you what to learn about LEDs then my new LED kits should do the job! They are ideal for schools and clubs or someone who just wants to change to LED lighting in their home or business.

Whatever the case may be I am available any time to help out, so if you need a kit or LED parts then let me know by email (eyecatchu@yahoo.com.au) or by Mob: 0408458645.

lines.text: Here is the complete LED light kit. Now before starting this project you need to check all parts as in the photo.   Check list as follows: 1 x PCB, 6 x 1W LEDs, 1 x LED lens cover,  1 x Main heat-sink and top casing.
lines.text_raw: Here is the complete LED light kit. Now before starting this project you need to check all parts as in the photo.   Check list as follows: 1 x PCB, 6 x 1W LEDs, 1 x LED lens cover,  1 x Main heat-sink and top casing.

lines.text: WARNING: LEDs ARE STATIC-SENSITIVE, SO YOU MUST WEAR AN ANTI-STATIC WRIST STRAP BEFORE HANDLING LEDs.
lines.text_raw: WARNING: LEDs ARE STATIC-SENSITIVE, SO YOU MUST WEAR AN ANTI-STATIC WRIST STRAP BEFORE HANDLING LEDs.

lines.text: You need to make sure that the LEDs are soldered the correct way on the PCB. If you look closely at the LED you will see that one end has a small hole. This is the positive end (+ ve ).
lines.text_raw: You need to make sure that the LEDs are soldered the correct way on the PCB. If you look closely at the LED you will see that one end has a small hole. This is the positive end (+ ve ).

lines.text: Now solder the LEDs to the PCB using your anti-static tweezers to pick up the LEDs.
lines.text_raw: Now solder the LEDs to the PCB using your anti-static tweezers to pick up the LEDs.

lines.text: WARNING: Make sure the LED is oriented the correct way before soldering to the PCB.
lines.text_raw: WARNING: Make sure the LED is oriented the correct way before soldering to the PCB.

lines.text: NOTE: Kit can be supplied with LEDs mounted on PCB and pre-tested if needed
lines.text_raw: NOTE: Kit can be supplied with LEDs mounted on PCB and pre-tested if needed

lines.text: Here's the finished PCB with the LEDs soldered.
lines.text_raw: Here's the finished PCB with the LEDs soldered.

lines.text: Now check the two screws  on the PCB top plate. If loose tighten up.
lines.text_raw: Now check the two screws  on the PCB top plate. If loose tighten up.

lines.text: NOTE: Don’t over-tight otherwise you will strip the threads.
lines.text_raw: NOTE: Don’t over-tight otherwise you will strip the threads.

lines.text: Mix a small amount of  thermal epoxy paste  for a few seconds, mix well.
lines.text_raw: Mix a small amount of  thermal epoxy paste  for a few seconds, mix well.

lines.text: WARNING BE CAREFUL  NOT TO GET IT ON YOUR HANDS
lines.text_raw: WARNING BE CAREFUL  NOT TO GET IT ON YOUR HANDS

lines.text: Also put some paste on the bottom of the LED then stick down onto the top of heat-sink NOTE Make sure the LED +ve and 0v solder pads are centre with the U groove that's on the heat-sink side
lines.text_raw: Also put some paste on the bottom of the LED then stick down onto the top of heat-sink NOTE Make sure the LED +ve and 0v solder pads are centre with the U groove that's on the heat-sink side

lines.text: WARNING: LEDs ARE STACTIC SENSITIVE SO YOU MUST WEAR A UNTI STATIC WRISTBAND WHICH IS CONNECTED TO EARTH
lines.text_raw: WARNING: LEDs ARE STACTIC SENSITIVE SO YOU MUST WEAR A UNTI STATIC WRISTBAND WHICH IS CONNECTED TO EARTH

lines.text: NOTE: Don’t touch the LED face lens. (yellow colour) press down from the outer edges of the led.
lines.text_raw: NOTE: Don’t touch the LED face lens. (yellow colour) press down from the outer edges of the led.

lines.text: Once epoxy has cured then solder on the wire lead proved in kit
lines.text_raw: Once epoxy has cured then solder on the wire lead proved in kit

lines.text: Now feed the wire lead through the centre hole of the PCB.
lines.text_raw: Now feed the wire lead through the centre hole of the PCB.

lines.text: Now pull the wire lead gently from the bottom of heat-sink.
lines.text_raw: Now pull the wire lead gently from the bottom of heat-sink.

lines.text: Check the PCB now for any solder shorts.  Now set power supply up and do a light test.
lines.text_raw: Check the PCB now for any solder shorts.  Now set power supply up and do a light test.

lines.text: The DC Power supply is set for testing  out lamp.  Votage : 15-18VDC  Current set at 200-250ma
lines.text_raw: The DC Power supply is set for testing  out lamp.  Votage : 15-18VDC  Current set at 200-250ma

lines.text: WARNING:  Max current for this lamp is 350ma.  [ SEE NOTE ]
lines.text_raw: WARNING:  Max current for this lamp is 350ma.  [ SEE NOTE ]

lines.text: Place a small amount of Glue on the cover edges only, but not to much.
lines.text_raw: Place a small amount of Glue on the cover edges only, but not to much.

lines.text: NOTE: Be careful not to get glue on the lens front or back
lines.text_raw: NOTE: Be careful not to get glue on the lens front or back

lines.text: Once lens cover is in place then press down gently for a few seconds then leave to dry.
lines.text_raw: Once lens cover is in place then press down gently for a few seconds then leave to dry.

lines.text: Ok now just screw on the top casing to finish off.
lines.text_raw: Ok now just screw on the top casing to finish off.

lines.text: Warning; don’t screw on to tight otherwise you will damage the LED’s on PCB.
lines.text_raw: Warning; don’t screw on to tight otherwise you will damage the LED’s on PCB.

lines.text: If you have reached this stage, then congratulations! You are just about finish this project; all you need to do now is power t up. Connect the lamp to a DC power supply 15-18 VDC and current set at 250ma for testing only.
lines.text_raw: If you have reached this stage, then congratulations! You are just about finish this project; all you need to do now is power t up. Connect the lamp to a DC power supply 15-18 VDC and current set at 250ma for testing only.

lines.text: WARNING: These LEDs are super-bright, so make sure the lamp is pointing at a wall! DON'T LOOK AT THEM HEAD-ON WHEN THE POWER IS ON!
lines.text_raw: WARNING: These LEDs are super-bright, so make sure the lamp is pointing at a wall! DON'T LOOK AT THEM HEAD-ON WHEN THE POWER IS ON!

lines.text: SEE NOTE: This Lamp needs a contanst crrent LED Driver set at 350ma and voltage between 18-21VDC                                                   LED driver for this lamp is available from James Electronics.
lines.text_raw: SEE NOTE: This Lamp needs a contanst crrent LED Driver set at 350ma and voltage between 18-21VDC                                                   LED driver for this lamp is available from James Electronics.

lines.text: If you have reach this stage, Then congratulations on your built LED Ceiling Down light.
lines.text_raw: If you have reach this stage, Then congratulations on your built LED Ceiling Down light.

guide.summary:
Ceiling Down-light LED lamp kit.  

Price AUD $26.70. Complete kit.  
Shipping cost is extra.   
Discount on bulk (email us).

LED Driver is not included in kit (extra)
guide.title: LED Down-light Lamp (600-660 lumens)
